subject: Data
title: Anchoring: The First Number Wins
description: A short lesson to help you apply Anchoring: The First Number Wins.

hook.text: A store prices a jacket at $500, then 'slashes' it to $200. You feel like you saved $300. You probably overpaid.

buildup.text: Anchoring bias means the first number you see disproportionately influences your judgment of all that follow.

discovery.text: Kahneman and Tversky showed that even random numbers â€” like a spun wheel â€” anchor subsequent estimates.

twist.text: Negotiators, advertisers, and fundraisers all exploit anchoring. The 'suggested donation' box is an anchor.

climax.text: Being aware of anchoring doesn't eliminate its effect. Even experts fall for it when they're not careful.

punchline.text: The first number you hear sets the range for all that follow.

quiz.question: What is anchoring bias?
options: The first number seen disproportionately influences subsequent judgments
Being anchored to one data source
